content: DBS DBS Vickers Securities Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 23 Sep 2018DBS Vickers - Self directed or Broker assisted?Hey Seedly folks, i am interested in investing  local REITs. From what i have looked, DBS Vickers seems to provide the lowest fees. Should i choose a self directed or broker assisted account and what are the difference between both of them? I tried looking up the search but couldn't get any relevant info. TIA!1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 24 Sep 2018Self directed for sure! If you are here asking this question, then you should be savvy enough to do your own trades. ie if you refer to this table here, it is either option 1) or 3) via the Cash upfront DBS vickers account or the normal online brokerage one. Way lower fees.​You can refer here for the full breakdown of the fees table: https://blog.seedly.sg/the-ultimate-cheatsheet-cheapest-stock-brokerage-in-singapore/​I personally use the cash upfront option via Vickers :) https://seedly.sg/reviews/online-brokerages​All the best, and feel free to continue asking questions here also.0 comments0
